title: League down, here's why!
body: Guys don't be too hard on Riot for the servers still being down hours after the maintenance. It tends to create a lot of bugs, and Riot, being a small indie company, can't afford to maintain 100% every time! Just be patient :)

replies.body: Small is a very wild understatement for Rito these days. They're a LOT bigger than what they were 5 years ago.

Riot Games is really big at the moment and probably one of the biggest but I haven't seen an issue like this for ages in my 5-6 years of playing this game but still... they are doing really well for a company who hasn't had these type of issues for ages and I think it was going to happen sooner or later.. I think people should just wait because they are still trying to find the problem and I think they are very nice for telling us whats actually happening instead of being a secretive company and tell us nothing when the servers are down.
You're out of your mind if you think Riot exercises any level of transparency to their consumers.

> [{quoted}](name=ButterTits,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=EPYAIhxZ,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-08-30T02:08:13.335+0000)

> You're out of your mind if you think Riot exercises any level of transparency to their consumers.

Explain to me how they aren't transparent?

Find recent (the last 2 years) figures surrounding their player base, player behaviour punishments, revenue, pro player decisions, team organisations decisions (especially Tainted Minds) or anything else surrounding the internals of their company and game/s as well as their parent organisation.

The best we get is a Reddit AMA post saying a whole bunch of vague explanations. Microsoft has more transparency than Riot, and we all know how good they are!

'being a small indie company'
